wikipedia_page.main: Mark Green  (28 March 1917 – 2 August 2009) was the suffragan Bishop of Aston from 1972 to 1982. He was born into an ecclesiastical family and educated at Rossall School and Lincoln College, Oxford. He studied for ordination at Ripon College Cuddesdon before a curacy at St Catherine's Gloucester. After World War II service as a chaplain to the Forces he held incumbencies at Hull and Acaster Malbis. He was then Rural Dean of Ainsty before  elevation to the episcopate. He retired in 1982.

response: Mark Green or Greene may refer to:
*Mark Green (ice hockey) (1967–2004), American professional ice hockey player
*Mark Green (racing driver) (born 1959), veteran driver in the NASCAR Busch Series
*Mark Greene, fictional character on the television series ER
*Mark Green, 92, British prelate, Bishop of Aston (1972–1982).The Right Reverend Mark Green
